page.title: 01The Stackpole Area
page.content: The Stackpole region is a quiet,rural area in South Pembrokeshire.It lies within the Castlemartin Peninsula and is situated roughly five miles from the nearest town of Pembroke. The area comprises the village of Stackpole, the hamlet of Stackpole Cheriton and outlying farms. There are no shops or public houses in this region and the post office closed down in March 1985. The area is very beautiful and is situated in the Pembrokeshire Coast National Park. The coastline is exceptionally attractive, and the hilly inland area also has much to commend it. There are two churches: Stackpole Elidor and St.Petrox and a school of 98 children situated in the village of Stackpole.
